DataElement.preferredDefinition: The category that describes the relative amount of different tissues present in the breast on a mammogram based on the updated 2015 edition of the American College of Radiology's Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS) reporting guidelines.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS) Atlas is a quality assurance guide to standardize breast-imaging reporting and to facilitate outcome monitoring. The atlas contains a guide to standardized mammographic reporting, including a breast-imaging lexicon of terminology, a report organization and assessment structure and coding system._A type of radiography used specifically to examine breast tissue. The procedure utilizes a low-dose of x-rays or radiation to generate an image. A mammography exam or mammogram, is used as a screening tool to detect early breast cancer in women experiencing no symptoms and to detect and diagnose breast disease._Describes the relative amount of different tissues present in the breast. A dense breast has less fat than glandular and connective tissue. Mammogram films of breasts with higher density are harder to read and interpret than those of less dense breasts.

Property.preferredDefinition: A type of radiography used specifically to examine breast tissue. The procedure utilizes a low-dose of x-rays or radiation to generate an image. A mammography exam or mammogram, is used as a screening tool to detect early breast cancer in women experiencing no symptoms and to detect and diagnose breast disease.:Describes the relative amount of different tissues present in the breast. A dense breast has less fat than glandular and connective tissue. Mammogram films of breasts with higher density are harder to read and interpret than those of less dense breasts.

Describes the relative amount of different tissues present in the breast. A dense breast has less fat than glandular and connective tissue. Mammogram films of breasts with higher density are harder to read and interpret than those of less dense breasts.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The breasts are almost entirely fatty, as defined by the visually estimated content of fibroglandular-density tissue within the breast, based on updated editions of the American College of Radiology's Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS).

Concepts.definition: The breasts are almost entirely fatty, as defined by the visually estimated content of fibroglandular-density tissue within the breast, based on updated editions of the American College of Radiology's Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mammographic finding of extremely dense breast composition, as defined by the visually estimated content of fibroglandular-density tissue within the breast, based on updated editions of the American College of Radiology's Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS).

Concepts.definition: A mammographic finding of extremely dense breast composition, as defined by the visually estimated content of fibroglandular-density tissue within the breast, based on updated editions of the American College of Radiology's Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mammographic finding of heterogeneously dense breast composition, as defined by the visually estimated content of fibroglandular-density tissue within the breast, based on updated editions of the American College of Radiology's Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS).

Concepts.definition: A mammographic finding of heterogeneously dense breast composition, as defined by the visually estimated content of fibroglandular-density tissue within the breast, based on updated editions of the American College of Radiology's Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: There are scattered areas of fibroglandular density, as defined by the visually estimated content of fibroglandular-density tissue within the breast, based on updated editions of the American College of Radiology's Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS).

Concepts.definition: There are scattered areas of fibroglandular density, as defined by the visually estimated content of fibroglandular-density tissue within the breast, based on updated editions of the American College of Radiology's Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.longName: Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System
Concepts.definition: The Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS) Atlas is a quality assurance guide to standardize breast-imaging reporting and to facilitate outcome monitoring. The atlas contains a guide to standardized mammographic reporting, including a breast-imaging lexicon of terminology, a report organization and assessment structure and coding system.

A type of radiography used specifically to examine breast tissue. The procedure utilizes a low-dose of x-rays or radiation to generate an image. A mammography exam or mammogram, is used as a screening tool to detect early breast cancer in women experiencing no symptoms and to detect and diagnose breast disease.

Describes the relative amount of different tissues present in the breast. A dense breast has less fat than glandular and connective tissue. Mammogram films of breasts with higher density are harder to read and interpret than those of less dense breasts.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
